body:
As an admin, you can enable single sign-on for your organization with OneLogin. Using Single sign-on (SSO) with HackerRank allows companies of any size to leverage their existing corporate directories and authentication systems to authorize employee access to HackerRank for Work. It enables the users to log in with a single ID and password to access a connected system.

To initiate the process, you must create an account on OneLogin. Before enabling SSO, you have to contact the HackerRank Customer Support team with an SSO metadata XML file or URL and obtain SSO key for your organization from them to configure single sign-on.

Prerequisites

  • You must have an account on OneLogin.
  • You must have obtained the SSO key for your organization from the HackerRank Customer Support team.

Steps

  1. Login to your OneLogin account as the OneLogin admin.
  2. Navigate to the Apps tab and then click Company App in the drop down menu.
  3. Click Add App from top right corner of the page.
  4. Enter your company name in the search box and press enter.


    Your search results are displayed.
  5. Click the required company from the search results.
  6. In the Configuration tab, the details of the selected company are displayed. Click Save to proceed.
  7. Navigate to the Configuration tab. In the Application Details section, enter the SSO key provided by the HackerRank Customer Support team and then click Save.
  8. Click the SSO tab, and  click the copy icon for the Issuer URL field.
    Copy this Issuer URL and send it to the HackerRank Customer Support team.

    After you provide these details, single sign on is enabled for your organization.
title: SSO with OneLogin
